data.description: Garuda means an eagle. It is also the name of the king of birds. Garuda is represented as the vehicle of Vishnu and as having a white face, an acquiline beak, red wings and a golden body.

technique.instruction: Focus on an unmoving point & place hands on the waist.
Shift the entire body weight onto the left foot.
Bend the left knee, cross the right foot over and hook the toes behind the left calf muscle.
Stretch the arms out in front, cross at the elbows with the left arm on the top, wrist at eye level and hands touching the forehead.
Hold for 10 to 60 seconds breathing deeply.
Release the arms and legs and come back to Tadasana.
Keep focusing on an unmoving point & place hands on the waist.
Bend the right knee, cross the left foot over and hook the toes behind the right calf muscle.
Stretch the arms out in front, cross at the elbows with the right arm on the top, wrist at eye level and hands touching the forehead.
Hold for 10 to 60 seconds breathing deeply.
Release the arms and legs and come back to Tadasana.

benefits: Improves flexibility in ankles, knees, hips, elbows & shoulders.
limitations: Avoid in ankle injury or surgery.
Avoid in knee injury or surgery.
